required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Image Quality Between "Double Low Dose" Liver CT and Standard Liver CT
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Image Quality Between "Double Low Dose" Liver CT Using AI-based Iodine Boosting Reconstruction and Standard Contrast-enhanced Liver CT in Patients With Colorectal Cancer: Prospective, Randomized, Non-inferiority Trial

brief_summary.textblock: In patients with malignancies, contrast-enhanced abdominal CT (hereafter abdominal CT) plays an important role in detecting carcinoma recurrence and assessing treatment response. In this study, we aim to investigate whether such a "double low" dose CT is feasible in patients with liver metastases of colorectal cancer using a vendor-agnostic artificial intelligence-based noise reduction and contrast enhancement software.

primary_outcome.measure: lesion conspicuity on portal venous phase
primary_outcome.description: qualitative analysis of lesion conspicuity on portal venous phase on five-point scale (higher score indicates better conspicuity). Lesion conspicuity is compared between the two arms.

secondary_outcome.description: qualitative analysis of lesion conspicuity on arterial phase on five-point scale (higher score indicates better conspicuity) Lesion conspicuity is compared between the two arms.
lesion detectability is compared between the two arms, compared with reference standard. Figure-of-merit was obtained.
Dose-length product (mGy*cm) is compared between the two arms.
The amount of CM dose is compared between the two arms.

arm_group.description: Standard dose protocol CT using standard radiation dose (120 kVp) and standard dose of contrast media, and reconstructed with commercially available reconstruction algorithm of the CT scanner.

Double low dose protocol CT using low radiation dose (120 kVp & 70% of reference mAs of standard dose CT) and low dose of contrast media, and reconstructed with commercially available vendor-agonistic AI-based software.

intervention.description: Simultaneous reduction of both radiation dose and contrast media dose
CT with standard radiation dose and contrast media dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- colorectal cancer (CRC) patients
- on surveillance or monitoring for liver metastasis (of CRC)
Exclusion Criteria:
- any relative or absolute contra-indication of CECT
- diffuse infiltrative type of liver metastasis or on monitoring for too many liver lesions
